bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to R.H. von Ezdorf, May 17, 1915

div1.p: [Carter] offers to meet with von Ezdorf.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to R.H. von Ezdorf, May 17, 1915
div1.opener:
May 17, 1915.
Surgeon R. H. von Ezdorf,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
New Orleans, La.
Dear Doctor von Ezdorf:
div1.p:
In accordance with Bureau orders, April 27th., I wish to
advise you that I will be in Montgomery, Ala., on the evening of
May 25th., where I would like to meet Mr. LePrince. I am sending
a letter to him giving details.

I can postpone this--say 24 hours--if by so doing it will
be an advantage to your work in any way, but, if you wish this,
please so advise me. I can also stay over the greater part of
the day at Montgomery and catch an afternoon train for Clanton,
instead of an early one, if by so doing I can see you.
